entry.title: Adoration of the Magi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the horses in Signorelli's Adoration of the Magi (pictured) have been said to be "badly-drawn ... with curious mannerisms of too closely-placed nostrils, and human eyebrows"?

entry.title: Navidades (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Navidades by Luis Miguel was the first Spanish-language album to enter the Billboard Top Holiday Albums since 1966?

entry.title: Christmas Raid (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Christmas Raid carried out by Confederate brigadier general John Hunt Morgan captured 1,800 Union soldiers?

entry.title: Justin Bieber's version (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that critics were confused by Justin Bieber's version of "Drummer Boy", in which he raps about himself and consumer products, which was seen to bastardize the original sentiment?

entry.title: The Littlest Angel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the classic children's Christmas story The Littlest Angel was written in just three days?

entry.title: their red holiday cups (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Starbucks raised money for HIV/AIDS research using their red holiday cups?

entry.title: Vom Himmel hoch (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mendelssohn's 1831 Christmas cantata Vom Himmel hoch, influenced by Bach's chorale cantatas, was based on a 1539 carol composed by Martin Luther?

entry.title: Santa Claus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Santa Claus really did on one occasion deliver coal?
